website_summaries.verdict: For runners looking to keep track of their workouts, the Nike+ SportWatch GPS offers a very attractive and simple solution, but it's on the pricier side.
pros: The Nike+ SportWatch GPS is very easy to use and has an attractive design
The watch has good battery life, and the Web component is a great resource for tracking workouts and getting training tips
cons: We had some initial problems with GPS, and positioning wasn't always accurate

customer_reviews.title: Great product and community
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch for about 3 years now and it is still going strong. My only complaint is that sometimes the GPS could act a little crazy on the long runs and mess up your speed or distance. I believe that having both sensors running would balance this out but all-in-all this helps me to prepare for my marathons as I can gauge my pace and distance. What I also love is when you sign up on the community you can run routes that others have mapped out or just join friends and make a little competition to keep you motivated to run farther every month.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: GPS watch, for the runner in you
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the fitbit is cute, but for runners, this is for you. Tracks your distance with satellites. In space. Probably in the mesosphere. Connect to computer and it gives you your stats. NOTE: battery life will be miserable until you update the firmware. It will update when you connect to computer and get the Nike program. Happy running! #Satellites
customer_reviews.author: I Am the One who Reviews

customer_reviews.title: these are the best sportwatches out there
customer_reviews.text: Looked brand new, It said refurbished, the only thing I noticed was it didn't come in it's original packaging. Didn't need that, I got it to replace the one I had bought 5 years ago, so I do know how to use it. I have say, these are the best sportwatches out there, but time has passed them by. This has no Bluetooth, music player, e-mail alerts, or all the things that are "the" normal now. It's a great basic watch with a great web site, Nike Connect, to support it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Tone

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!!!! There is no software ...
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!!! There is no software that supports this watch once the history is full you cannot use it. Nike discontinued the software as of April 2018 because they want you to use their apps. This was purchased as a gift when I tried to return it Amazon reached out to their supplier and was told it was too late. So if anyone buys this watch they will only be able to use it for a limited time. You are just throwing your money away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this for my husband who had read many great reviews about the watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who had read many great reviews about the watch. We looked for it in store but we do not have a Best Buy around so we bought it from amazon. Wish it would have been prime because shipping did take a little bit but he was very happy once he received it. It has been a great watch and easily chargeable. At this point we have had it for a couple months and on occasions ( only happened twice) but his watch shut off and completely reset while we were out shopping. We still do not know or understand why.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: nike sports watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nike sports watch while I was in Afghanistan, almost three years ago. I used this watch for every run. It works great, assuming you keep it charged. The one thing I do not like is that you must update the satellite info via the internet (by plugging it into your computer) before using it. While in Afghanistan, I did not always have access to internet via my personal computer. If the satellites are not updated, it takes forever to connect. And sometimes, it does not connect at all. Over all, I like this sports watch. But it is only good for running. Nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pegg

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this running watch
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this running watch. It's so stylish that I can wear even when I'm not working out. The functionality is great, and the GPS tracking is so accurate that it can even tell the difference between Lane 1 and Lane 3 on the track in terms of distance. My only complaint is that switching menus (from clock, to run history, to stopwatch, etc.) can feel a little clunky at times. It's two button presses instead of one, so not really a big deal. I'm just a hard sell for 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: So I just got the watch in today, and to my suprise it comes with a nike + sensor. So i will be canceling the other nike sensor I had on order. Before buying this watch I used a Android app to track my distance and it was completely in-accurate. After my run today, The distance was dead on. I dont own nike + shoes, to put the sensor in, so I pulled my sole insert out, and traced around the sensor, the dremeled a spot for the sensor. It worked perfectly. I dont even notice its there. Remeber to tap the dispaly to get it to light up in the dark!
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best part is when it did finally wear out (It ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my dad and he's used it every day since. The best part is when it did finally wear out (It took over a year I think, I'm really late posting this review) Nike replaced it for free because it wasn't user error that caused the damage. Anyways, the only down side about this product that I've heard is that you have to buy pedometers which go into your shoe, and they cost around $20.
customer_reviews.author: Maddison

customer_reviews.title: I almost returned this
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this watch and the clean face for time display. I was waiting to get the Pebble watch, which has much more functionality, but the reviews of its quality were so bad that I crossed that off my list. My principal disappointment in this watch is that it is clunky--big and heavy. Some may find that appealing; I don't. The band closes on my wrist on the last pair of holes, and I'm sure there are plenty of people with bigger wrists than mine. All in all, just ok. I functions fine with my Nike+ shoe insert.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hinman

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept for Nike
customer_reviews.text: The item got here on time and what was I was expecting from the seller. The watch linked up to the pedometer sensor the first time i used it. The GPS takes about 90 seconds to link up to the satellites and the routing seems to be pretty accurate. The only negative would be that the battery dies very quickly. I have to charge the watch every other day or else it is completely dead. I like the Nike online route history and the motivation features built into the watch. Good luck - Go run!
customer_reviews.author: Surfg8r

customer_reviews.title: I think they need more work
customer_reviews.text: This product is by far superior to others but yet it lacks connectivity and realiability. I like NIKE and well mostly all their products, only thing is that for a long time I could not see my runs on the Computer because and issue with NIKE . it took them a long time to fix the issue. Sometimes it takes a while to connect to the GPS and well I only stretch for about 5 to 10 minutes not 15 minutes or more. Yeah so not crazy about it but it is a cool watch and it looks kinda cool.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan A Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works
customer_reviews.text: The watch is fine if and when it works. I have problems getting it to sync when its plugged up. I often go outside and have to wait several minutes for it to connect to the satellite. If its overcast it seems to give inaccurate telemetry. The foot pod (sold seperately) does not work and the heart rate monitor (sold seperatly) is inaccurate much of the time, often I will be running at full sprint speed and it will say my heart rate is 0 so I tell my running friends that I'm dead. I hate waisting time getting it to work and getting bad data.
customer_reviews.author: whooloo

customer_reviews.title: Almost 2 years....
customer_reviews.text: and it just died on me. The watch seems to be still working but there is totally no display. Pretty disappointing for an expensive sports watch. Just got off an 800 help line. apparently there is no repair centers available anywhere in Asia. Either you get a replacement within 6 months or that is it! There goes the image of Nike quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ben N.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely garbage, it never finds the satellite or if it does it takes 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I am back after more than 1 year of use to give an honest review to this watch. This is terrible, it doesn't find the satellite every single time I run. I tried it in New Zealand, Australia and America and it always gives the same annoying problem " linking to satellite". Sometimes it does find the satellite when I have already completed 5 km...Absolutely a piece of garbage and I agree now completely with other reviewers saying to avoid this watch. Please guys go for a Garmin or Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this sports watch. I wish the battery life would last longer, but the product lasts as advertised. This is more of an 'operator' issue than the watch. The watch works great, lots of functionality, even works with heart monitor strap from my old Polaris watch. It downloads the data easy with the hidden USB on the watch band. It's durable, works great. It costs more than I would like but I have to say, I haven't regretted the purchase. It's comfortable, sleak looking for everyday wearing as well.
customer_reviews.author: TyJS31

customer_reviews.title: Great way to track runs.
customer_reviews.text: I have had no issues at all with fogging or anything of that nature. Then again I don't shower with it or take it on swims either. If it's raining out while your running just try to cover it a little. It's an electronic treat it as such and it'll work for you. 4 stars because I think the pace is a little off when I look at it at times. I'll go from a 6:30 pace to an 8:00 pace and back within a matter of 10 seconds without actually changing my pace. Nike plus site always displays a realistic pace when I upload the runs.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: My last Nike watch was better
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch, but my last one was better. I think my previous watch was called the Nike hammer. This watch has a good easy to read display. The drawbacks are how many buttons you have to press to get to the stopwatch. I also have had continual difficulty in getting the watch to connect to my shoe sensor. If you need a plain and simple watch it does the job, but Nike has made better ones in the past
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Decent runner's watch, slow to start up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help track my runs as I begin training for a half marathon. I found it easy to set up and use once it gets connected to the satellites (I'm not using the Nike+ sensor that also came with it). The display is clear enough to read during a run and it's help up well against sweat and mild drizzle so far. My only complaint is that it takes ~5 minutes each time to connect to the GPS satellites at the beginning of the run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, terrible charging band
customer_reviews.text: Band broke after only a few months. Nike has a great return policy, but it would be nice to not have to know that from multiple experiences. This design is terrible when it comes to the charging port. Features are good, and the watch looked nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nick & Staci

customer_reviews.title: Not Supported anymore DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Feels like we got scammed. Nike stopped supporting this product so it is impossible to use it to its full potential. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Poor accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for over a week, and it is not accurate. Multiple 2 mile runs were calculated to be 2.1 miles in one direction and 2.15 in the other. A 4.5 mile run ended up being a 4 mile run. The satellite connection took up to 5 minutes to connect. The software did not load correctly initially and did not register the device. Overall, poor device, poor configuration, and a loss of time and energy I'll not get back.
customer_reviews.author: steve mcnay

customer_reviews.title: it serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews concerning the accuracy of this device. I am not a professional runner. I run for fun and charity. I can't say it's 100% accurate with regard to distance, b/c I never ran on a track. But it surely gives me a sense of my speed and distance. there are very very ...very small differences b/w the distance recorded on my friend watch when we ran together and mine. I love it. In 5K and 5M races, it showed 5-8 sec more/less per the entire distance than the official time. and that also depended if I pushed the Start button at the right moment.
customer_reviews.author: maria trif

customer_reviews.title: There are way better watches for the money out there.
customer_reviews.text: Used this model for years, basically stuck with it so that all my data was in one place. Two big issues - first is that it can take forever to connect to satellite, so it's not uncommon at all to have your runs show up as short distance. Second is that, using 5 of these watches over about 6 years, most of them have wound up with moisture under the glass of the face, just from normal use/running in the rain. Very frustrating - finally made the jump to Garmin and it's far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Aiello

customer_reviews.title: This is a great GPS watch with simple functionality and ergonomic design
customer_reviews.text: This is a great GPS watch with simple functionality and ergonomic design. I like the way the USB connects. It generally picks up satellites in about 30 seconds. I don't do any outdoor running or hiking without it. The Nike Plus web app is decent. I generally don't use it much. I haven't used the foot sensor, so I'm not sure how well that works. Overall, this is a good value for a solid sports watch that will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pange

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this watch on the "Used" listings, package had minor damage and device was tested and cleared for sale. The watch itself was perfectly fine upon delivery. It shipped really fast with no issues from seller. My only discrepencies are within the product itself. The watch isn't as solid as I thought it would be. I question the actual durability of the product. It records data well for wha I need. Overall I recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a watch.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is 2 years old to me and still works. I hit it hard on something at one point and it did stop working. But I took it apart and cleaned the insides with a Q Tip in hopes that it would do something to help fix itand I don't know for some reason it started working again after doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Keats

customer_reviews.title: Want to track your runs? This is it!
customer_reviews.text: This item is fantastic if you want to track your runs, analyze your progress or maintain it. You can post your runs on Twitter and Facebook, and you get feedback from goals, see the routes you've ran, and get an all around picture of what you are doing. The only thing I wish you could set on the distance screen is you can only choose your pace or current speed; Id rather see a stopwatch running above the distance read-out.
customer_reviews.author: SSG M

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Makes me run faster. Huzzah!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new watch. Easy to navigate. Love the ability to customize the main screen view with pace and distance shown together. Would prefer longer battery life and also a better ability to customize how the history screen renders. There appears to be no way to show pace and other variables side by side on the watch in history mode. Otherwise, I just love it. It has transformed the way I run. Last thing... It would be cool if they came out with a version that let you upload your history via Bluetooth so you didn't have to manually plug the watch into your laptop everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W Pelecky

customer_reviews.title: Time For Something Else
customer_reviews.text: A good idea if you've nothing to do except interact with a software driven device. Invasive information seemingly requested.
customer_reviews.author: Verrocchio

customer_reviews.title: This watch is durable and well Designed
customer_reviews.text: I don't used it for it full capabilities. I wear it for work. I am a professional plumber by trade and need to time install for billing and time testing for pressure. In general all watches I've owned in the past decade have been Nikes. Not that I a die hard fan of their products my no means, but as far as their watches go, i really like how there bands don't have pins in them that break. Maybe its certain models only but those are one I buy. The watch setting function are very intuitive also.
customer_reviews.author: John Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Performs as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I do not live in a big city, but I do live/run around lots of trees, so people who have trouble with signals around big city buildings I can understand long startup times for GPS. I often run with my wife who uses the Nike+ GPS app on her iPhone and this watch seems to be more accurate and not lose signal like the iPhone does. If you are looking for motivation, this little guy makes you want to beat your previous records, and it keeps track online, so it triggers your competitive spirit a little with yourself. Works great for this fitness runner, not a marathoner.
customer_reviews.author: slomobile

customer_reviews.title: Died on me before could get my data.
customer_reviews.text: It was somewhat difficult to get setup and linked to GPS; the first time it didn't collect my data; i recharged it for my second run [an actual race--a 30K]. This time it linked and worked from the start of the race but after 3 hours, it completely died on me. TOTALLY DEAD. I thought it couldnt hold the charge, but I cannot recharge it or anything--not even an error message. Lost all data. I was very disappointed. Also the font sizes are either too big [for the main item] or too small. Should have something in between which would make it easier so dont have to slow down to read. Will have to send it back now.
customer_reviews.author: universitytimes

customer_reviews.title: Great running watch!!
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch a bunch!! It tracks my speed and avg speed, mileage plus more when you connect to Nike.com. I like the fact that you don't need the Nike shoe pod, but I'm sure it would be more accurate with it. IMO its a little overpriced. I've had it for about a year with no problems, so far so good. Nice product, but wait until it goes on sale somewhere if you can hold out.
customer_reviews.author: Yoga Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not a good company to do business with
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch for my niece to track her cross country races. The watch showed up and worked ok. Shortly after receiving the watch the band started to separate exposing the wires for the usb. it is clearly a manufacture defect and not a part that can be replaced locally. It has to be replaced by the manufacture. I contacted Heart Rate Monitors USA who I purchased the watch from and they refused to replace the watch. Not a good company to do business with.
customer_reviews.author: J1999

customer_reviews.title: Condensation failures
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Nike + Sport watch in a little over five years. I like almost everything about it from the Web site to external equipment (shoe pod and Heart monitor) to the data displayed. HOWEVER the prior two failed due to internal condensation solely from perspiration. I even disassembled dried/ inspected/cleaned and lubed the seal with only a few months extended life. While the amortization of this watch is less than running shoes, this is a luxury item, not a necessity and my expectations were much higher.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Allen

customer_reviews.title: Careful Use Gives Lasting Satisfaction...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I love the wireless design. I read other reviews that warned how others have broken the charging USB connector. So I have been very careful to open and close the band. After over a year of satisfied use, I have not broken off the connector. I love the size of the digits and the functionality of the watch. It meets my needs very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. D.L. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Loved it. But...
customer_reviews.text: Ran with it like 3 times then the screen just went blank while sitting on my counter overnight. Tried charging it, resetting it and factory reset but the screen woul only go back to a few specks worth in the screen. Before this happened I loved the watch- waiting on a refund/return. I will fix this review as soon as one of the two are granted.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner watch.  Neat website, some flaws though
customer_reviews.text: Good: Comfortable watch Works well with included heart rate monitor and shoe pod Website it nice with some cheese to get you motivated Looks good Bad: Data is locked to Nike unless you use a 3rd party tool I can't find out how to simply view my heart rate without running (my Garmin friends can) No biking support (Nike is up front about this, I just wish it had it) It can sometimes take a while to lock on GPS
customer_reviews.author: fiftiesdean

customer_reviews.title: Nike+ Sport Watch
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas present for my boyfriend, who is currently training for the Marine's BMT. He goes running just about every other day, and was carrying his phone while running to keep pace and what not. Although he didn't mind lugging his phone around, he was overjoyed the first time he took this watch for a run. The GPS works perfectly, though at times, it takes a while to catch a signal. He wears this watch everyday and it holds up. Great purchase, but when I received it, it seemed like it was already opened. Maybe that's why I got it for a few bucks less than on the Nike website.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I only have one complaint, the usb connector does seem very fragile. I read the reviews and have been very light handed with it and have not had a problem. I have not had a sync problem and I connect to the shoe thing, GPS and a Polar heartrate monitor. The mapping seems to be working very well. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great watch to purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch to purchase! It's easy to use and held its charge for 4/5 days easy. I am training for a race and this watch is the one thing I don't leave home without. I would recommend this watch for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Torres

customer_reviews.title: good watch bad design.
customer_reviews.text: came with a scratch on the scree. screen is plastic and not scratch resistant. NIKE said "will replace it for you, but you have to bring it to a store." Closest store with watch in stock was 70 minutes away so I planned to wear it until one became available in my area. I'm not sure that it wasn't a "knock off" because after 3 weeks the paint started to wear off the watch. It is hard to believe that NIKE would make a for active people that would wear off after 3 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Yesef Medina

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. I use nike+ because I'm more interested in the ecosystem than the actual hardware, which can always be improved. Nike just released an API as well, so hopefully, we'll see great things from the nike+ series. One thing that really irritates me about the watch is the proprietary usb cable. If I want to charge or sync it, I have to remember exactly where one specific cable is instead of just grabbing a micousb which I have more of than Tribbles. Hopefully this will be changed in future iterations. The "tap to illuminate" the can also be dodgy at times.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I love my Nike+ SportWatch GPS. Very accurate and pretty comfortable for the size. I have very small wrists and it still fits good without being in the way of normal activity. Only downside is sometimes it takes 10+ minutes to connect to GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Facklam

customer_reviews.title: Nike Sport Watch GPS
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME .. this Is a great product . . the gps is so cool . after uploading . it tells you everything . even the elevation.. tried this out on the water while canoe. told me how high the water was too . that is cool . but . wouldn't save that as a run tho . just snap a pic of it
customer_reviews.author: DEAN Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great running watch
customer_reviews.text: Great running watch. It was sometimes hard to get a GPS signal, but wen you did it tracked really well. Mine eventually got moisture in the unit due to the connection point of the straps. I might get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Turiano

customer_reviews.title: GPS doesn't connect
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch in general, and have had three in the past that have worked perfectly fine. However, this one doesn't connect to GPS, despite having updated all software multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Sara K

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is GREAT!! I haven't used the chip and have relied strictly on the GPS and it is exactly what I was expecting and works great! I highly suggest if you want to track runs and don't have full faith in the Nike chip. It's a little bigger than I was expecting but it didn't take long at all to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Scruffy Runner

customer_reviews.title: My son is training for his first half marathon with this . . .
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted this for training for his first half marathon and uses it all the time. He loves it! The numbers are easily read and measures his heart rate and does all he needs it to to help him train and to keep track of his training and increasing/decreasing his speed for interval training . . . Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: This product has been everything as advertised so far. I have used the watch for about a month and the ability to track workouts is very motivating. I give it 4 stars based on the functionality which is wonderful, but the watch is not as comfortable as the Polar I used prior to this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this sportwatch. Great aid for the marathon runner.
customer_reviews.text: My son took up runnning this past year and is running 5k and 10k marathons. He uses this watch for competition and practice runs. He comes home and downloads the information and it brings up the map of his run and he can see where his weakness and strengths are on each run. It has helped him to improve his duration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best watch ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was really attached to my previous watch, but after 4 years it finally died. This watch was a nice upgrade and I love that I can track my running progress. It syncs easily to the computer and uploads all of your workout info in Nike Plus. Highly recommend this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan L.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking watch, with decent functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Both my boyfriend and I have this watch. When we run side-by-side using GPS, our watches show a slightly different distance and pace. The light feature, which is turned on by tapping the screen, works 75% of the time. I've enjoyed using it and think it is overall a pretty accurate measure of distance and pace.
customer_reviews.author: EGSMOM

customer_reviews.title: but one of my runs never registered so I strongly recommend using the sensor for your shoe
customer_reviews.text: Not too heavy and relatively accurate. I used to run without the sensor, but one of my runs never registered so I strongly recommend using the sensor for your shoe. The sensor does usually take a few minutes to register with the watch, but after that it works really well. Make sure you use the sensor and enable the GPS- that's how you get the most out of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch. Comes with a shoe sensor.
customer_reviews.text: The watch does everything you could need. It even shows elevation of the entire run overlaid on a map with mile markers and an animated route replay. Pace, Distance, Calories etc... The Nike+ comes with the shoe sensor in the box. NO need to buy a sensor even though the description says over and over that it is " sold separately" by Polar or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: it works well, GPS takes about 10-15 seconds to connect and your good to go. very nice Watch. I enjoy using it very much. I use it for walking, running and biking. Good job Nike.
customer_reviews.author: BillyS

customer_reviews.title: That was my biggest concern and I've been very pleased. I recommend this watch for any distance
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for over 6 months and put over 300 miles on it. I run in a very humid climate which causes me to sweat quite a bit, but I have not had any issues with fogging or water/rain getting in the screen. That was my biggest concern and I've been very pleased. I recommend this watch for any distance. I've used it on +15 mile trail runs with limited sky visibility and had no issues. Love the website too.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: get a smart watch or something
customer_reviews.text: The gps tracking is accurate but the watch is cheaply made. After about 4 months, the adhesive on the back of the watch was failing. Water got into the seal and voila. get a smart watch or something.
customer_reviews.author: urfriend

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it...
customer_reviews.text: Works great - syncs up quickly (2 min max so far). Makes you want to run faster/further. The feedback after a run is a nice touch. Beware, you will want to 'impress' the watch; perhaps being 'monitored' makes you work harder. Well worth the money - I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Lines across the screen
customer_reviews.text: There are permanent lines across the screen, like on iPods before the screen goes out completely. Used like new my a**
customer_reviews.author: Fstarr

customer_reviews.title: Felt short of expecations
customer_reviews.text: Nike has you locked into their proprietary app. Not too big a fan of their app as well. No exporting to Strava or RunKeeper right out of the box, you'll have to rely on some 3rd party web app exporters, which I don't trust too much for security reasons. Tapping the screen for lighting the screen felt really unresponsive and unnatural. Pretty bulky for a watch as well. I ultimately decided to return.
customer_reviews.author: Gaucho Liu

customer_reviews.title: Product is not great for indoor running and apparently needs several (over 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is not great for indoor running and apparently needs several (over 20 or so) runs to calibrate before it begins to give you accurate readings. It was also not a comfortable fit and although relatively light, folks with small wrists may have issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: TheGeo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's been impossible to pair with Polar heart rate band
customer_reviews.author: Luky Uri

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: i have two of these and they both do not work. Nike offers no support. Can't change battery. It will be great and fun to use for about 4-6 months if you are lucky. Save your money. My daughter felt bad for me and brought me the second one. That one stopped working too. Worst product and product support
customer_reviews.author: Lins Reed

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: So far, no issues. I chose this watch bc of the overall design, ease of use and Nike plus webpage. All of my expectations have been met so far. My only complaint would be that it takes a little while to obtain the GPS signal. Updated: I had to call Nike's customer service for a new usb cord. They have the best customer service and the people that answer the phone are actually runners and very helpful. I didn't have to wait to be connected too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hart

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished watch was bought and the real issues are the charging process and bulk of the watch
customer_reviews.author: Larry L

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the hardware
customer_reviews.text: I bought the sport watch for my daily running. It fits well, and comfortable. Easy to use, both GPS and shoe pod. Software is easy to install. The Nike website is great! Your running history can be easily reviewed on the PC, and smart phone. The problem I just had is that the plastic cover that covers the USB port is broken within a year I bought this watch without any blunt forces to it. I am not happy with this. The watch still works but the wrist belt doesn't connect too well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Chen

customer_reviews.title: Good morning, my watch have a complaint in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good morning, my watch have a complaint in the last days I plug it into the computer and it tells me is FULL charge, then disconnect and actually not loaded across the screen blur as if he had gotten water and that happens when I wear it only. I think it's an expensive item so that in a few days this presenting these problems. Please help.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo Viquez

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective unit!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed - on top of arriving late, the refurbished watch I received was never able to acquire satellite signal. Given that, I was not able to use it during my Chicago Marathon race.
customer_reviews.author: JPD

customer_reviews.title: Just like it is described
customer_reviews.text: Received my Nike+ SportWatch GPS today. It took about 15 minutes to download software and sync the watch. Took it for a 5 mile spin and it worked just exactly the way I wanted it. I'm very happy with it. My only complaint is that the band needs to be about 1/2 inch longer for big wrists like mine. Other than that, I had no problems with it and I like the big number display also.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Westfall

customer_reviews.title: I like this sportswatch very much
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like this sportswatch very much. I wear it every time I go out for run. I wore the watch while runingn a half-marathon event, and the distance shown on the watch was only off by 0.006 of a mile. Pretty neat! I would not run without it.
customer_reviews.author: KenN

customer_reviews.title: Great working GPS watch that actually looks cool
customer_reviews.text: This watch works great and the Nike resources are great. The difference between this watch and Garmin is the customization. This watch is simple to use but doesn't have all the workout features the Garmin has. However, those always got in the way for me and having an easy to use watch is much more important for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul DeSalvo

customer_reviews.title: Nike GPS watch
customer_reviews.text: Worst product Nike has ever made. They should be embarrassed to their name on this garbage. The GPS hasn't worked with consistency since I bought this watch. The battery is a disgrace and the only reason you would buy this watch is for the Nike+ software because thats the only redeeming feature of this entire waste of money. 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Yearwood

customer_reviews.title: Junk, just get a Garmin
customer_reviews.text: First, the intervals alarm is very quiet, extremely difficult to hear and there is no way to adjust the volume. Second,, have had my watch for 7 months and it is already broken. It will not connect to the Nike Connect program, it only charges. And because I bought it here, it is not covered under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Stone

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 50 runs. Was never accurate on the occasions it decided to pick up a signal. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: I've been blown away at this watch's inaccuracy and my dissatisfaction saw new heights today when the band broke apart exposing the internal mechanics to the slightest bit of condensation which seized the the screen into utter uselessness after fewer than 50 runs.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: This is great replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Last Nike+ SportWatch is getting ready to give out after 7 years of use. This is great replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth S.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch and motivational tool
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I dont so reviews often but i have to on this item. I bought this watch because i needed a watch but was also getting back into running. This watch has helped very much in assisting in my everyday runs. With it ability to keep and display pace, i am able to keep pushing and watch my improvement during my run. It a great motivator and also just a good looking and comfortable watch. Bottom line is if you are looking for a watch and a running motivational tool then this watch is for you.
customer_reviews.author: derek o'grady

customer_reviews.title: This watch is perfect for marathon running or tracking your distance and calories
customer_reviews.text: This watch is perfect for marathon running or tracking your distance and calories. It also keeps a record of your runs and you can upload it to Nike to see everything.
customer_reviews.author: Candis

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding device
customer_reviews.text: This watch is excellent! It's light and easy to use without bogging me down. But most importantly, it provides me exactly what I need to run trails and interval training w/ variations in course and times. With this watch I always -- and easily -- have a complete and accurate record of my accomplishment -- including course.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: This watch did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid runner and ordered this watch after reading a lot of reviews, and was highly disappointed. For starters,it is not comfortable. The band is a hard plastic and not very flexible. The main reason I returned this watch for a refund (and replaced it with a Garmin, which is awesome) is that it did not work. I used it about 10 times, and only 3 times did it connect to a satellite for gps to be enabled. Even when the gps was enabled, the pace per mile was not accurate. I do not recommend this watch for any serious runner who wants a good watch to aid in training.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Smith

customer_reviews.title: So cool
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, uploaded the software and charged it fully first and went for a 10 mile run - such a great watch. Splits, averages, distance and once uploaded to Nike site even elevations. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a running watch
customer_reviews.author: ryedogg

customer_reviews.title: needs more work
customer_reviews.text: nice except that if you are training it does not measure accurately, running 10 miles it showed less 10 consistently. serious training calls for accuracy and this product unfortunately is not there yet. i sent it back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: just another Amazon nut

customer_reviews.title: it looks good, but after few months the wrist band start ...
customer_reviews.text: it looks good, but after few months the wrist band start showing some defection and now it's cut and I couldn't find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: bouderbala

customer_reviews.title: Nike watch gps power by tom tom
customer_reviews.text: Yes it came the date it was supposed too the watch looks awesome and it holds a very good charge on it i love it i recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: CURTIS HOLIDAY

customer_reviews.title: Very good seller. Unfortunately the problem of this product is ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good seller. Unfortunately the problem of this product is that it doesn't allow a repair once out of order
customer_reviews.author: Frank Oliver

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Nike+ users
customer_reviews.text: I used to use my iPhone to keep track of my Nike Running stats. But the simplicity of this watch made it worth the extra bucks. I have not had a problem yet, and I have had it for over a year. If you are going to be a runner and you use Nike, it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper Jonson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, incorrect distances
customer_reviews.text: I previously used the Motoactv but when that died on me, I tried the Nike SportWatch. I love the ease of use with the watch, and the online component is easy to use as well. It's a cinch to charge the watch but I found that the GPS distance isn't so accurate. I used the watch when I ran a half marathon -- and at the end, it say I ran 13.4 miles instead of 13.1. But for a general guide on my pace and overall distance, it's good to have if not completely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Tanenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my husband's birthday. It worked fine the first time he used it and we plugged it in our computer to view the details of his run. Since that time, every other time we plug it in, it has lost his runs, it says there are no workouts to upload. Today we plugged it in and somehow erased all the data on the watch. It has really been the worst item I have ever purchased on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Battery is fine without GPS on (months in fact). It is comfortable enough, could stand to be a bit lighter. The band is adjustable to an extent. I seem to be in between 2 notches though.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves it
customer_reviews.text: This was an anniversary present for my husband (his request). He really loves it. He loves being able to see his runs on the computer, and he loves getting a visual display of how he did.
customer_reviews.author: A Mom

customer_reviews.title: Performs better than my old Garmin Forerunner 110
customer_reviews.text: The Nike+ SportWatch locks onto the satellites much quicker than my old Garmin Forerunner 110. Additionally, the larger numbers are easier to read and the buttons much more intuitive than the Forerunner.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Shuley

customer_reviews.title: Great watch to run with!
customer_reviews.text: I've been running with Nike+, but I found it a little bit inconvenient to bring my iPod Touch every time I run. This watch is so easy to carry (as it's a watch!) and easy to use. I'm so glad I got this one!
customer_reviews.author: Misali

customer_reviews.title: Very Undependable
customer_reviews.text: I am training for a race, and need some consistent feedback from this device on how I'm doing with each run. Unfortunately, it can only "connect" to the GPS satellites about half the time. Frustrating!! I gave it two stars because when it works, it is accurate and provides good information. I'm not happy with the inconsistency, and plan to try something from Garmin. Wasted $$
customer_reviews.author: Phil Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very nicewatch. Really do as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Very nice watch. Really do as advertised. But seemingly Nike is producing less shoe with slot for Nike Shoe pod. You may want to consider before getting this product.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Watch band bad
customer_reviews.text: The band is my greatest concern, had the same watch love the functions BUT the band did hold up to body sweat and daily use taking on and off. Band finally broke in many places!
customer_reviews.author: jgjerde

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for my first GPS watch. I wish it was more durable but running watches aren't exactly meant to be worn with rough, manual labor anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Rustom Pangilinan

customer_reviews.title: OK for running but not for cycling
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch for running and cycling purpose. Pro: lock on to GPS faster than my garmin forerunner 610, looks nice, easy to turn on back-light(just double tap the watch) Cons: Can only display 2 information at a time, my garmin can display max of 4 information at same time. Not good enough for cycling because the maximum speed the watch will display is 36km/h, I know i am going faster but the watch will only display max of 36km/h.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Jee

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: This watch is just what I wanted--sleek in style, easy to operate and gives me the data that I need without all the fluff. I'm training for a Half Ironman and I have had no problem with battery life. Longest training bike and run was 5 hours and it worked great. I'm no computer guru and even I can easily download the information from the watch and compare my stats. I'm very happy and satisfied with this Nike GPS watch.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Spitzer

customer_reviews.title: Need looking at
customer_reviews.text: Not good at all it is not waterproof and if u leave it in the sun it will mush up
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Redman

product_meta.title: Nike+ SportWatch GPS Powered by TomTom (Black)
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM


WHAT IS THE NIKE+ SPORTWATCH GPS?
Combining Nike’s understanding of the athlete with the GPS expertise of TomTom, Nike+ SportWatch GPS is a game changer for runners. Nike+ SportWatch GPS powered by TomTom uses both GPS technology and the Nike+ shoe sensor to capture every step of your run. Runners can then upload their data to the nikeplus.com website, where new mapping features allow them to see their runs and find popular routes, track their goals, receive coaching tips, challenge friends, and share their progress through Facebook and Twitter.












KEEP TRACK
 * See or hear your distance, pace, time and calories burned
 * Get detail on every run when you upload to Nike+


GET A PUSH
 * Set goals to keep you moving
 * Use Nike+ Challenges to motivate yourself and others
 * Get custom training programs that help you prepare for a race, event or sport
 * Receive trophies, medals and attaboys as rewards for your efforts




STAY CONNECTED
 * Use Nike+ to stay connected with your friends and millions of runners worldwide
 * Find the most popular areas to run

QUICK START:
GPS and the Nike+ sensor combine to give you accurate info -­-­ indoors or out -­-­ without the wait. Using the Nike+ sensor, you can start a run without having a GPS signal. Also, if you’re running outdoors in an urban canyon or tunnel where the GPS signal is obstructed, the Nike+ sensor kicks in for seamless data tracking.


Personal Coach: Reminds you to run, stores your Nike+ run history, and remembers your PRs. Set up the type of program you want based on your experience level, event distance and how frequently you are able to run each week. Nike+ Coach will track your individual runs via graphs, allowing you to compare your times and better understand the trends in your overall performance. You’ll also get tips and advice to ensure you’re training properly.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Nike+ SportWatch GPS, Nike+ Sensor, Quick-start Guide, USB Cable (for Hard-to-access USB Ports)

FEATURES:
Stopwatch: You can start, stop, pause and mark up to 50 laps by tapping the screen. Once you are done, you can review your total time, best lap time, average lap time or individual lap times. This data is stored on your watch until you rest it and will not be uploaded to nikeplus.com.

Alarm: You can set an alarm on your watch. When the alarm is set there is a visual indication on the watch face.

Time Set: The time of day or date can be set on the watch without needing to plug it in and use Nike+ Connect.

Pace/Speed: Runners can now choose between displaying pace and displaying speed on the watch.

Laps: The sensitivity of the tap feature has been improved so that users can confidently get a tap when they want, and not when they don't.

ULTIMATE TRACKER:
Tracks your time, distance, pace, heart rate and calories burned. Nike+ SportWatch GPS works with the Polar Wearlink Transmitter to track your beats per minute.

Inverted Screen: The screen can be inverted to display black text on a white background for those runners that prefer it.

Favorite Metric: Runners can choose between displaying lap time or a different favorite metric when in auto or manual laps mode.

Auto-Looping Metrics: In addition to pushing the buttons to scroll through secondary metrics, runners have the option for their metrics auto-­loop.
feature_bullets: Water resistant Nike+ SportWatch features TomTom GPS for accurate speed and distance information, indoors or out--even if the GPS signal gets interrupted

Track your time, distance, pace or speed, beats per minute (BPM) heart rate (with optional HRM sensor sold separately by Polar), and calories burned; view your mapped route with pace data/changes in elevation on Nikeplus.com, Stopwatch feature
Track NikeFuel on Nikeplus.com after every run; Time/Date set feature
Rechargeable lithium polymer battery charges via USB, provides eight hours of run time with the GPS and sensor both turned on, up to 50 days of standby power
Join challenges and connect with friends as a member of Nikeplus.com-view/share routes, find popular running areas, share activity on Facebook or Twitter
